intro: Brachystegia diloloensis var. brevifoliolata, commonly known as the short-leaved brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, lanceolate leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. It plays a significant role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in moist, lowland forests.
